title: Jason Hatcher's bye week plans with his wife include making 'some magic'
text:
Jason Hatcher’s bye week plans with his wife include making ‘some magic’ Resize Text By Scott Allen October 25 at 8:16 PM Follow @ScottSAllen 
Defensive end Jason Hatcher says the bye week will allow the Redskins to “let our hair down and get away from football” and get healthy in advance of a game against the New England Patriots. 
After the Redskins’ 31-30 win over Tampa Bay on Sunday , Comcast SportsNet’s Tarik El-Bashir asked how Hatcher and his wife plan to spend his rare time off. 
“Well, I’m getting away from the kids,” Hatcher said . “My kids’ grandma, [she] came up, [she’s] going to help the nanny. We’re going to go to Dallas, work on some business for a few days, and then we’re going to go to Miami and hang out with Ricky [Jean-Francois] and his fiancée. 
[ Best and worst moments from the Redskins’ comeback win ] 
“We’re just going to kind of get away and, you know, get some me-and-her time, because she be busy with the business and I be playing football, so we barely see each other. It’s going to be good to get away and kind of, you know… make some magic.” This was the look on Hatcher’s face after he talked about making some magic. (Via Comcast SportsNet) 
Hatcher apparently shared his magic-making plans with multiple reporters. Jason Hatcher, in multiple interviews, promises to make magic with his wife during the bye. #magic 
— Dan Steinberg (@dcsportsbog) October 25, 2015 
As for the hat, CSN’s Chick Hernandez asked if Hatcher is going for the “Amish look” or “Billy Jack.” 
“Oh yeah, yeah, I’m definitely Amish,” Hatcher said. “My wagon’s about to pick me up in a minute. … In case y’all don’t know that, I don’t watch TV, I just hang out. So, it’s going to be good to go to Miami. I’ve never been.”
